cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 110 miles SE of Isla Beata, Dominican Republic
cyclone.trajectory: tracking west-northwest toward the southern coast of Hispaniola, then Jamaica, eastern-central Cuba and eventually toward the Florida Straits
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southern coast of Hispaniola near the Haiti–Dominican Republic border

weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane warnings south coast Dominican Republic (Punta Palenque to Haiti border), southern Haiti (Port-au-Prince to DR border) and Jamaica; tropical-storm warnings parts of north Haiti and south-east Dominican Republic.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southern Hispaniola, Jamaica, eastern and central Cuba, eventually Florida Keys / peninsula coastline
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: Unavailable for St. Croix, VI (location not listed in wind-probability table)
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Unlikely (forecast 1–3 in. with isolated 5 in. possible)
weather_observation.wind: Brief tropical-storm-force gusts possible as outer rain-bands passed to the south early 2 Jul; sustained winds mostly below gale force.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer bands brought 1–3 in. of rain with isolated higher pockets; minor flash-flood potential.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents around the Virgin Islands.
